---
title: "Forecast"
output: html_notebook
---


```{r}

# Load the required packages
install.packages("forecast")
library(forecast)

# Set the seed for reproducibility
set.seed(123)

# Generate the time series data
n <- 60  # Number of data points
ts_data <- ts(rnorm(n), start = c(2010, 1), frequency = 12)

# Generate a seasonal component
seasonality <- sin(2 * pi * (1:n)/12)

# Add the seasonal component to the data
ts_data <- ts_data + seasonality

# Add a linear trend
trend <- 0.5 * (1:n)
ts_data <- ts_data + trend

# Add some random noise
noise <- rnorm(n)
ts_data <- ts_data + noise

# Visualize the generated time series data
plot(ts_data, main = "Generated Time Series Data", xlab = "Year-Month", ylab = "Value")

# Save the generated data to a CSV file
data <- data.frame(Value = ts_data)
write.csv(data, "time_series_data.csv", row.names = FALSE)

```
